noun.description: A sudden, usually temporary malfunction or irregularity of equipment.
examples: a draft version was lost in a computer glitch

verb.description: Suffer a sudden malfunction or irregularity.
examples: her job involves troubleshooting when systems glitch

origin: 1960s (originally US): of unknown origin. The original sense was a sudden surge of current, hence malfunction, hitch in astronautical slang.
